greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the sum of quadratic nonresidues of A002145(n) (the n-th prime == 3 mod 4).
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Christian Aebi, Grant Cairns, Sums of Quadratic residues and nonresidues, arXiv:1512.00896 [math.NT], 2015.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..(A002145(n)-1)/2} (-k^2) mod A002145(n). - _J. M. Bergot_ and _Robert Israel_, Nov 09 2020
maple: for j from 1 to p-1 do
if legendre(j,p)=1 then sp:=sp+j; else sm:=sm+j; fi; od;
mathematica: f[p_] := Total[Range[p-1] ~Complement~ Table[Mod[k^2, p], {k, (p-1)/2}] ]; f /@ Select[Range[3, 1000, 4], PrimeQ] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 16 2018, after _Robert Israel_ *)
program: (PARI) lista(nn) = forprime(p=2, nn, if(p%4==3, print1(sum(k=1, p-1, if (!issquare(Mod(k, p)), k)), ", "))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Nov 09 2020
xref: Sums of residues, nonresidues, and their differences, for p == 1 mod 4, p == 3 mod 4, and all p: A171555; A282035, A282036, A282037; A076409, A125615, A282038.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 20 2017
